result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Glen Lamberti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Designer Drugs (>3-10g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "C" Felony], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(hm)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today July 27, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.
Court will allow Probation to be served in Illinois.
Court notes 1 day credit if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
DNA surcharge.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Michael Hart   DF:  Nicholas Glen Lamberti appeared. Case called at 10:53 a.m. ADA McKinley gives recommendations. Atty Hart in agreement and gives sentencing recommendations.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 14CF330. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possess MDMA w/ intent to sell or deliver Class E Felony in 14CF330.  
Crt orders:

-  S/W  3 years probation. Report by no later than 4 p.m. today. Conditions of bond will continue until checks in with probation. Court will allow probation to be served in Illinois. 1 day Credit if revoked.

- Complete 40 hours of community service

- fine with court costs and DNA surcharge

- Provide DNA sample

- AODA with follow through. 

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Amber L Hahn   DF ATTY:  Misfeld   DF:  Nicholas Glen Lamberti appeared. Case called at 2:05 pm.   Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Atty presents request for subsitution. ADA Hahn notes Defendant's last name to be spelled Lamberti. No objection from Atty.  Court informs Def if charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty enters NG plea. Speedy trial waived. Bond continues. km

Status conference on August 25, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Somerset Music Festival or any campgrounds in Somerset, Wi.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
